event.title: 3rd Dialogue for Global Innovation  on Urban Mobility, Smart Energy and Healthcare focussed at Risk Management of Advanced Science & Technology
event.description:
We will be holding a sympsium at ams in Austria. To confirm your attendance, please click "attend"button. It would be great if you could please join our symposium!

The symposium program is as follows:

Program:

MC: Aska Takeshiro, Visiting Scholar, GRIPS

9:00-9:10 Opening Address
Representative of Austria Federal Economic Chamber
9:10-9:20 Introductory Speech
Yutaka Kuwahara,
Representative Director, ams Japan and President & CEO, GVIN Ltd.
9:20-10:00 Plenary Speech
Innovation of Urban Mobility, Smart Energy and Healthcare
Ryo Hirasawa, Professor-Emeritus, University of Tokyo
10:00-10:40 Plenary Speech:
Trend of Innovation Studies in Risk Management of Advanced Science& Technology
Sir Michael Gregory, Professor, Institute for Manufacturing,
University of Cambridge
10:40-11:20 Plenary Speech
A Proposal on the IT Car-Network for Urban Mobility
James Collier, CTO, Neul Ltd.

11:20-11:30 Break

11:30-12:30 Case Studies of Innovation on Various Issues (1)
Smart Energy

Nick Collings, Professor, Cambridge University
Consideration of IT Potential for Mobility
(Name) AIT (Austria Institute of Technology)
New Public Transportation and Multimedia for Urban Mobility
Harald Moser, ATS Electronica Solutions

12:30-13:30　Lunch

13:30-16:20 Case Studies of Innovation on Various Issues (2)
Experimental Operation of New Concept Car at Gothenburg Project, Sweden
Hans Persson, Volvo
3D Imaging LIDAR for Advanced Driving Assistance Systems
Kazuo SATO, Toyota Central R&D Laboratories
A Nobel Approach to a New Autonomous Car
Shigeo Numazawa, Denso
Innovative Smart Mobility for Autonomous Car
Massimiliano Lenardi, Hitachi Europe R&D Center

(Break 10 minutes)

Needs and Key Issues in the Next Generation Mobility
Tetsuya Gomi and Toshitake Kawai, Honda
R&D activities of Japanese firms in automotive industry
Koichi Sumikura, NISTEP/GRIPS
University-Industry collaboration in automotive industry
Hiromi Saito, Chiba University/GRIPS/NISTEP
Deepening Relationship between Austria and Japan:
ams Internship program with Japanese Universities, Todai and Shuto University
Yutaka Kuwahara, ams Japan and GVIN Ltd.

16:20-16:30 Break

16:30-17:30 Panel Discussion
Moderator: Thomas Stockmeier, Senior VP, ams
Panelists: The Speakers above

17:30-17:40 Closing Remark
Thomas Stockmeier, Senior VP, ams
event.address: ams AG  Tobelbader Strasse 30 A-8141 Unterpremstaetten, Austria
